title: Paris votes on SUVs: The end of the road for big cars?
summary: Despite calls for cleaner individual transport, new cars have massively increased in weight over the last 30 years. So how did our vehicles become so big? And why is it an issue for the environment?

title: French government joins forces with Netflix to attract tourists
summary: In partnership with Atout France, the platform is launching a tourist guide promoting the filming locations of movies and series produced by Netflix. Added to this is a Government Information Service-supported commercial from the platform promoting tourism in France.

title: US and UK strike dozens of Houthi targets in Yemen
summary: It's the second wave of assaults following the targeting of Western shipping sailing near Yemen.

title: Senegal president calls off February 25 election
summary: Macky Sall made the announcement just hours before official campaigning was due to start, saying lawmakers were investigating two Constitutional Council judges whose integrity in the election process has been questioned.

title: Scotland survive Wales rally in Six Nations thriller to end Cardiff curse
summary: A wide lead for Scotland turned into a nail-biting finish after an astonishing Welsh comeback fell one point short of victory.

title: For the first time, an Irish nationalist will lead Northern Ireland's government
summary: Sinn Féin Vice President Michelle O'Neill was nominated as first minister as the government returned to work after a two-year boycott by unionists.

title: US strikes back at pro-Iranian militias in Syria and Iraq but avoids direct confrontation with Tehran
summary: The bombing of seven sites was in response to the death of three American soldiers in a drone attack in Jordan, the culmination of a campaign against Washington's troops by groups close to Iran.

title: England squeezes past Italy in Six Nations opener
summary: Elliot Daly and Alex Mitchell scored England's two tries with George Ford kicking the rest of the points for Steve Borthwick's men, who claimed their first round one win in the rugby championship since 2019.

title: AFCON 2024: Mali versus Côte d'Ivoire is an athletic and political showdown
summary: The two West African neighbors face off on Saturday in the quarter-finals of the Africa Cup of Nations. While there is a large Malian diaspora in Côte d'Ivoire, political relations between Abidjan and Bamako are strained.

title: Paris: Several people injured in Gare de Lyon knife attack, one man arrested
summary: According to a provisional police report, the attack left one person seriously injured, with a non-life-threatening prognosis, and two slightly injured. The attacker's motives are still unknown.

title: French farmers on why they struggle
summary: Farmers from around France told Le Monde about their problems and frustrations, which are as varied as their activities, and the land itself.

title: Drug trafficking: The new routes for cocaine deliveries on France's Atlantic coast
summary: Bales of drugs have been washing up on the beaches of western France at an unprecedented rate in recent months. To avoid major ports, traffickers are increasingly resorting to 'drop-offs,' which are intended to be picked up by a second boat.

title: The ongoing struggle to mobilize young Ukrainians to join up
summary: Some recruitment centers resort to heavy-handed methods, while the age of conscription could be lowered from 27 to 25.

title: Taylor Swift, America's ultimate star, is driving the Trump crowd up the wall
summary: Donald Trump's supporters fear the singer's influence on her young fans, which could weigh decisively in the November elections. And they have no qualms about saying that she's involved in a conspiracy.

title: Anatomy of a French failure at the Oscars
summary: Justine Triet's 'Anatomy of a Fall' was rejected in favor of 'The Taste of Things' to represent France at the Oscars, a decision that has come back to haunt everyone involved.

title: Nicaragua, a thriving hub for US-bound migrants
summary: Managua organizes the arrival on its territory of many people from the continent and also from Africa and Asia, seeking to reach North America. The country reaps a financial windfall from this and sees it as a way of embarrassing Washington.

title: From beef tongues to yuzu fruit: The extraordinary world of the Rungis market
summary: The world's largest fresh produce market, just south of Paris, feeds 18 million people and has an annual turnover of €10,299 million.

title: France agrees to ratify the EU Artificial Intelligence Act after seven months of resistance
summary: The draft European regulation on artificial intelligence took a decisive step forward on Friday, receiving unanimous endorsement from all 27 European Union member countries.

title: Is Facebook 'outdated?' Twenty years on, why the social network is still the most popular
summary: Twenty years after it was created, Facebook is sometimes perceived as a social network in decline. And yet, with over 2 billion daily active users, it is by far the most widely used social network in the world.

title: Chile wildfires kill at least 46 in 'unprecedented catastrophe'
summary: Forest fires have moved toward more populated areas in central Chile, leaving a trail of devastation. Firefighters have struggled to reach the most threatened neighborhoods.

title: Biden sweeps South Carolina with 'loser' taunt at Trump
summary: Biden had urged voters to turn out despite the race being a foregone conclusion.

title: The end of the road in Corsica for Puglia mafia boss
summary: Marco Raduano escaped from prison in Sardinia a year ago. Italy's most-wanted fugitive, known for his ultra-violent methods, was arrested on Thursday as he was about to have dinner in a restaurant in the city of Bastia.

title: Fashion creative directors: Where are the women?
summary: From Gucci to Tod's to Bottega Veneta and more recently, Alexander McQueen, many fashion houses have hired male designers. What are the reasons behind this absence of women, when fashion is essentially made for them?

title: The Bukele method gets put to the vote in El Salvador
summary: Running for re-election on Sunday, the Preside Nayib Bukele is touting his record on tackling gang violence, achieved at the cost of encroaching on freedoms. His victory is safe.

title: North Korea steps up provocations ahead of US elections
summary: Repeated missile launches, a rapprochement with Russia, aggressive rhetoric towards South Korea: Kim Jong-un's warmongering attitude is worrying some American military experts.

title: US employment soars even higher than expected following economic growth
summary: The US economy created twice as many jobs than was expected in January, following a record-setting month of December 2023. This came with an acceleration in wage growth. But public opinion isn't siding with President Biden despite the stock market's rally.
